content.title: Technology Development Fund (TDF) Scheme
content.details: Technology Development Fund (TDF) has been established to promote self-reliance in Defence Technology as a part of the 'Make in India' initiative. It is a programme of the Ministry of Defence executed by the Defence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) to meet the requirements of the Tri-Services, Defence Production and DRDO. The Scheme encourages participation of public/private industries, especially MSMEs and startups, to create an ecosystem for enhancing cutting-edge technology capability in the defence sector.
benefits: Funding support of up to INR 50,00,00,000/-
Funding may be up to 90% of the total project cost
Collaboration with academia or research institutions
Funding linked to mutually agreed milestones
Funds released in advance against a bank guarantee or reimbursement based on milestones
eligibility: Public limited company, private limited company, partnership firm, limited liability partnership, one-person company, sole proprietorship registered in India
Startup must be recognized by Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
Startup incorporated for less than 3 years from the date of submission of application
Nascent Startup should be incubated at a Central/State government assisted incubator
Startup should not have received any grants for a similar technology
Startup must be owned and controlled by a Resident Indian citizen with at least 51% shareholding
content.application_process: Every interested Industry/Technology expert/Academia must first register on the TDF portal. After registration, they must log in and furnish all required details.
documents_required: Utilization Certificate & Statement of Expenses (UC & SE)

faqs.question: What is Technology Development Fund (TDF) scheme?
faqs.answer: Technology Development Fund (TDF) has been established to promote self-reliance in Defence Technology as a part of the 'Make in India' initiative.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Defence has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: How is MSME defined for the purpose of the TDF Program?
faqs.answer: MSME is defined as per the MSMED Act 2006 for the purpose of the Technology Development Fund Scheme.

faqs.question: Is this Scheme specific to any sector?
Can an organisation apply in multiple TDF Projects simultaneously?
What is the nature of the proposals to be supported under TDF Scheme?
faqs.answer: Proposals for significant up-gradation/improvements in existing products/processes, technology readiness level upgradation, development of futuristic technologies, and import substitution of components.

faqs.question: Is MSME/Startup firm still eligible to compete for TDF award if it forms a 50-50 joint venture with a non-profit or foreign firm?
faqs.answer: No, the Industry with excess of 49% foreign investment will not be eligible.

faqs.question: Can I empanel a consultant to apply on my behalf?
Do I need to pay any service fee to DRDO/DTDF for applying for the scheme?
How can non-profit research institutions qualify to participate in the TDF program?
faqs.answer: Non-profit research institutions can only apply in collaboration with an Indian Industry.
